Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2009 05:03AM Cathy123 wrote: MomsDaughter, Hi, my name is Cathy.  I'm still in the process of all the testing.  Dx DCIS Stage 1, Grade 3, ER-PR-HER2-  This was found in the right breast.  After MRI they found something in left breast and I'm having another core biopsy this Thursday.  I have a feeling I'm going to be having a double done and my doctor feels I would be a good candidate for DIEP.  After all that, to my question.....How was your recovery?  I understand that recovery time is less for DIEP than TRAM flap.  Can you give me some advice?  My breast surgeon, oncologist, etc. are all from Lankenau Hospital in Wynnewood, PA.  I feel I have the very best treatment I could be receiving, however, the waiting is starting to get to me.....not sleeping, worrying all the time.  Thanks for any help and advice.
Posts.Title: How long between diagnosis and surgery or treatment? Anxiousmama katiec

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2009 09:48AM Cathy123 wrote: Hi Michelle, I'm 58 and had a bilateral, salpingo ooph, and immediate DIEP reconstruction on 7/17. Still having a lot of tightness in the breast area, stomach is doing much better, just a little puffy and swollen.  The worst part for me has been the breast area, doing my exercises and walking every day but the tightness is getting very old and wearing me down.  Hope all goes well for you. Cathy
Posts.Title: Breast and Ovary Surgery at the Same Time strngwmn39 Silverpullet

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2009 09:23AM Cathy123 wrote: Dolores, Good luck tomorrow.  We will all be thinking of you and praying for you.  I'm scheduled for bi-lateral with immediate DIEP and ooph on July 17th. Cathy
